page.title: 01OUR AREA FROM MILORD'S ROAD.
page.content: Our area is generally a hollow of land forming the source area of the Tresillian stream ,a tributary of the Fal.The fields are mainly grass. In the distance is Summercourt,a small village. In the middle distance there are moors and some small woods .There are some fields which have poor grasses and reeds. In a part of the moor there is a settlement of caravans and chalets. Five fields have some cattle and one has some sheep in it. Behind us to the east the huge mounds of sand mark the edge of the china clay area. A stack in the woody moorland is evidence of former mining. The area is cut across by two roads the A30 and A39. About 30 pylons spoil the view across the area but there are only a few houses in Summercourt which disturb the rural scene.
